newsitem.title: USA: Koch raises U.S. posted crude prices 25 cts/bbl.
newsitem.headline: Koch raises U.S. posted crude prices 25 cts/bbl.

text.p: Koch Oil said it raised the price it will pay for U.S. crude oil by 25 cents a barrel, effective today.
The increase brings the new price for U.S. benchmark grade West Texas Intermediate to $24.00 a barrel, and West Texas Sour to $21.75 a barrel.
Light Louisiana sweet crude is now $24.00 a barrel, and Oklahoma sweet is $24.00.
